deleted_at.description:
The date and time when the server or image was deleted.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_ :

::

   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

The ``±hh:mm`` value, if included, returns the time zone as an
offset from UTC.

For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``.

If you omit the deleted-at date and time stamp, its value is
``null`` .

address.description: The floating IP address that you want to remove.

address.description: A floating IP address to associate with the instance.

fixed_address.description:
A fixed IP address that you want to associate with the floating IP
address.

tenant.description: The UUID of the tenant to which to give access.

host.description:
Host ID to add to an aggregate, which is a collection of multiple
groups of hosts that share common resources like storage and
network.

disk.description: Integer value for the minimum disk space in GB.

fixed_ips.description:
Fixed IP addresses with subnet IDs.

If you request a specific fixed IP address without a ``net_id`` ,
the request returns a ``400 BadRequest`` error code.

interfaceAttachment.description: Specify the ``interfaceAttachment`` action in the request body.

net_id.description:
The ID of the network for which you want to create an interface.

The ``net_id`` and ``port_id`` parameters are mutually exclusive.

If you do not specify the ``net_id`` parameter, the OpenStack
Networking API v2.0 uses the network information cache that is
associated with the instance.

port_id.description:
The ID of the port for which you want to create an interface.

The ``net_id`` and ``port_id`` parameters are mutually exclusive.

If you do not specify the ``port_id`` parameter, the OpenStack
Networking API v2.0 allocates a port on the specified network.

fixed_ips.description: Fixed IP addresses with subnet IDs.

createBackup.description: Specify the ``createBackup`` action in the request body.

rotation.description: An integer value that represents the number of backups to maintain.

disk.description: The amount of disk space, in GBs.

id.description: The ID for the new flavor, which is a unique integer value.

name.description: The name for the new flavor.

ram.description: The amount of RAM, in MBs, for this flavor.

vcpus.description: The virtual CPUs, in a whole integer amount, for the new flavor.

name.description: The name to associate with the keypair.

public_key.description: The public ssh key to import. If not provided, a key is generated.

security_group.description: Specify the ``security_group`` action in the request body.

ip_protocol.description: The IP protocol: ICMP, TCP, or UDP.
The IP protocol: ICMP, TCP, or UDP.

availability_zone.description: The availability zone in which to launch the server.

block_device_mapping_v2.description:
Enables booting the server from a volume when additional parameters
are given. If specified, the volume status must be ``available`` ,
and the volume ``attach_status`` in the OpenStack Block Storage
database must be ``detached`` .

boot_index.description:
The boot order of the device. Use ``-1`` for the boot volume. Use
``0`` for an attached volume.

config_drive.description:
Enables metadata injection in a server through a configuration
drive.

Specify ``true`` to enable a configuration drive. Otherwise,
specify ``false`` .

delete_on_termination.description:
To delete the boot volume when the server stops, specify ``true`` .
Otherwise, specify ``false`` .

destination_type.description:
Defines where the volume comes from. A valid value is ``local`` or
``volume`` .

device_name.description:
Describes a path to the device for the volume you want to use to
boot the server.

fixed_ip.description:
A fixed IPv4 address for the NIC. Valid with a ``neutron`` or
``nova-networks`` network.

flavorRef.description:
The flavor reference for the desired flavor for your server
instance.

Specify as an ID or full URL.

guest_format.description:
Specifies the guest server disk file system format, such as
``ephemeral`` or ``swap`` .

imageRef.description:
The image reference for the desired image for your server instance.

Specify as an ID or full URL.

max_count.description:
The maximum number of servers to launch when the service provider
enables multiple server launch.

metadata.description:
Metadata key and value pairs. The maximum size of the metadata key
and value is 255 bytes each.

min_count.description:
The minimum number of servers to launch when the service provider
enables multiple server launch.

networks.description:
A ``networks`` object. By default, the server instance is
provisioned with all isolated networks for the tenant.

Optionally, you can create one or more NICs on the server.

To provision the server instance with a NIC for a network, specify
the UUID of the network in the ``uuid`` attribute in a ``networks``
object.

To provision the server instance with a NIC for an already existing
port, specify the port-id in the ``port`` attribute in a
``networks`` object.

You can specify multiple NICs on the server.

personality.description:
File path and contents (text only) to inject into the server at
launch. The maximum size of the file path data is 255 bytes. The
maximum limit refers to the number of bytes in the decoded data and
not the number of characters in the encoded data.

port.description:
To provision the server instance with a NIC for an already existing
port, specify the port-id in the ``port`` attribute in a
``networks`` object. The port status must be ``DOWN`` . Required if
you omit the ``uuid`` attribute.

return_reservation_id.description:
Set to ``True`` to generate a reservation ID for each server. Omit
this attribute to create servers without a reservation ID. This
extended attribute is enabled when the service provider enables
multiple server launch.

security_groups.description:
One or more security groups. Specify the name of the security group
in the ``name`` attribute. If you omit this attribute, the server
is created in the ``default`` security group.

source_type.description:
The source type for the volume. A valid value is ``blank`` ,
``snapshot`` , ``volume`` , or ``image`` .

user_data.description:
Configuration information or scripts to use upon launch. Must be
Base64 encoded.

uuid.description:
To provision the server instance with a NIC for a network, specify
the UUID of the network in the ``uuid`` attribute in a ``networks``
object. Required if you omit the ``port`` attribute.

name.description:
The server group name. A non-empty string with no leading or
trailing spaces. Maximum length is 255 characters.

policies.description:
A list of one or more policy names to associate with the server
group. The list must contain at least one policy name.

Each policy name must be a non-empty string with no leading or
trailing spaces. Maximum length is 255 characters.

id.description: The ID for the server group.

members.description: A list of members in the server group.

name.description: The name of the server group.

policies.description: A list of policies associated with the server group.

server_group.description:
A ``server_group`` groups VMs based on common characteristics so
that you can apply policies to groups or categorize servers for
scheduling purposes.

The flavor reference for the desired flavor for your server
instance.

Specify as an ID or full URL.

guest_format.description:
Specifies the guest server disk file system format, such as
``ephemeral`` or ``swap`` .

imageRef.description:
The image reference for the desired image for your server instance.

Specify as an ID or full URL.

metadata.description:
Metadata key and value pairs. The maximum size of the metadata key
and value is 255 bytes each.

networks.description:
A ``networks`` object. By default, the server instance is
provisioned with all isolated networks for the tenant.

Optionally, you can create one or more NICs on the server.

To provision the server instance with a NIC for a network, specify
the UUID of the network in the ``uuid`` attribute in a ``networks``
object.

To provision the server instance with a NIC for an already existing
port, specify the port-id in the ``port`` attribute in a
``networks`` object.

You can specify multiple NICs on the server.

personality.description:
File path and contents (text only) to inject into the server at
launch. The maximum size of the file path data is 255 bytes. The
maximum limit refers to the number of bytes in the decoded data and
not the number of characters in the encoded data.

port.description:
To provision the server instance with a NIC for an already existing
port, specify the port-id in the ``port`` attribute in a
``networks`` object. The port status must be ``DOWN`` . Required if
you omit the ``uuid`` attribute.

security_groups.description:
One or more security groups. Specify the name of the security group
in the ``name`` attribute. If you omit this attribute, the server
is created in the ``default`` security group.

source_type.description:
The source type for the volume. A valid value is ``blank`` ,
``snapshot`` , ``volume`` , or ``image`` .

user_data.description:
Configuration information or scripts to use upon launch. Must be
Base64 encoded.

uuid.description:
To provision the server instance with a NIC for a network, specify
the UUID of the network in the ``uuid`` attribute in a ``networks``
object. Required if you omit the ``port`` attribute.

injectNetworkInfo.description: Specify the ``injectNetworkInfo`` action in the request body.

fixed_ips.description: Fixed IP addresses with subnet IDs.

hypervisor_hostname.description: Hypervisor host name, retrieved from the per-server listing.

ip_protocol.description: The IP protocol: ICMP, TCP, or UDP.

id.description: The ID for the server group.

members.description: A list of members in the server group.

name.description: The name of the server group.

policies.description: A list of policies associated with the server group.

next.description: Moves to the next item in the list.

previous.description: Moves to the previous item in the list.

lock.description: Specify the ``lock`` action in the request body.

migrate.description: Specify the ``migrate`` action in the request body.

block_migration.description: If true, block migration is allowed.

disk_over_commit.description: If true, disk over commit is allowed.

os-migrateLive.description: Specify the ``os-migrateLive`` action in the request body.

resetState.description: Specify the ``resetState`` action in the request body.

state.description: The desired state of a server.

pause.description: Specify the ``pause`` action in the request body.

tenant.description: The UUID of the tenant to which to give access.

host.description: Host ID to add to an aggregate.

adminPass.description:
Use this password for the rescued instance. Generate a new password
if none is provided.

rescue.description: Specify the ``rescue`` action in the request body.

rescue_image_ref.description:
The image reference to use to rescue your server instance. Specify
the image reference by ID or full URL.

If you omit an image reference, default is the base image
reference.

adminPass.description:
The password that enables the administrator to access the rescued
instance.

parameters.description:
The date and time when the image or server was created.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_ :

::

   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

The ``±hh:mm`` value, if included, returns the time zone as an
offset from UTC.

For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``.

If you omit the created-at date and time stamp, its value is
``null`` .

/v2/{tenant_id}/os-volumes_boot.description:
Preconditions

- You can attach a volume to a server with a status that is not
  locked.

- You can boot to a volume when its status is ``available`` .

- You can boot to a volume when the volume was created as a bootable
  volume.

Asynchronous Postconditions

- After successfully booting a server, the volume status changes to
  ``in-use`` .

Troubleshooting

- If the volume status remains in ``available`` state, the request
  failed. Ensure that you meet the preconditions and run the
  request again. If the request fails again, investigate the server
  and the volume status.

parameters.description:
The date and time when the image or server last changed status.

Use this query parameter to check for changes since a previous
request rather than re-downloading and re-parsing the full status
at each polling interval. If data has changed, only the items
changed since the specified time are returned in the response. If
data has not changed since the ``changes-since`` time, an empty
list is returned.

For example, issue a GET request against the following endpoint to
list all servers that have changed since Mon, 24 Jan 2015 17:08:00
UTC:

::

   GET /v2/010101/servers?changes-since=2015-01-24T17:08:00Z

To enable you to keep track of changes, this filter also displays
images and servers that were deleted if the ``changes-since`` value
specifies a date in the last 30 days. Items deleted more than 30
days ago might be returned, but it is not guaranteed.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_ :

::

   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

The ``±hh:mm`` value, if included, returns the time zone as an
offset from UTC.

For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``.

If you omit the time zone, the UTC time zone is assumed.
parameters.name: changes-since

parameters.description: The UUID for the image.
parameters.name: image

parameters.description:
The UUID for the specific flavor, which is a combination of memory,
disk size, and CPUs.
parameters.name: flavor

parameters.description:
The name of the server as a string. Can be queried with regular
expressions. The regular expression ``?name=bob`` returns both bob
and bobb. If you must match on only bob, you can use a regular
expression that matches the syntax of the underlying database
server that is implemented for Compute, such as MySQL or
PostgreSQL.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description:
Filters the results by the status of the server. For example, you
can filter on ``ACTIVE`` .
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Name of the host as a string.
parameters.name: host

parameters.description:
Requests a specified page size of returned items from the query.
Returns a number of items up to the specified limit value. Use the
``limit`` parameter to make an initial limited request and use the
ID of the last-seen item from the response as the ``marker``
parameter value in a subsequent limited request.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
Specifies the ID of the last-seen item. Use the ``limit`` parameter
to make an initial limited request and use the ID of the last-seen
item from the response as the ``marker`` parameter value in a
subsequent limited request.
parameters.name: marker

/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/acti.summary: Gets a console for a server instance.
/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/acti.title: Get console

/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/acti.description:
All associated data and resources are kept; however, anything still
in memory is not retained. To restore a shelved instance, use the
``unshelve`` action. To remove a shelved instance, use the
``shelveOffload`` action.

Preconditions

- The server status must be ``ACTIVE`` , ``SHUTOFF`` , ``PAUSED`` ,
  or ``SUSPENDED`` .

- If the specified server is locked, you must have administrator
  privileges to shelve the server.

Asynchronous Postconditions

- After successfully shelving a server, its status changes to
  ``SHELVED`` and the image status is ``ACTIVE`` . The server
  instance data appears on the compute node that the Compute
  service manages.

- The Compute service automatically deletes the instance on compute
  nodes and changes the server status to ``SHELVED_OFFLOADED`` if
  the server is booted from volumes or ``shelved_offload_time`` is
  set to 0.

Troubleshooting

- If the server status does not change to ``SHELVED`` or
  ``SHELVED_OFFLOADED`` , the shelve operation failed. Ensure that
  you meet the preconditions and run the request again. If the
  request fails again, investigate whether another operation is
  running that causes a race condition.

parameters.description: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
parameters.name: tenant_id

parameters.description: The UUID for the server of interest to you.
parameters.name: server_id

/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/acti.summary: Shelves a running server.
/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/acti.title: Shelve server

/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/acti.description:
Data and resource associations are deleted. If an instance is no
longer needed, you can remove that instance from the hypervisor to
minimize resource usage.

Preconditions

- The server status must be ``SHELVED`` .

- If the specified server is locked, you must have administrator
  privileges to shelve-offload the server.

Asynchronous Postconditions

- After you successfully shelve-offload a server, the status changes
  to ``SHELVED_OFFLOAD`` . The server instance data appears on the
  compute node.

Troubleshooting

- If the server status does not change to ``SHELVEDED_OFFLOADED`` ,
  the shelve-offload operation failed. Ensure that you meet the
  preconditions and run the request again. If the request fails
  again, investigate whether another operation is running that
  causes a race condition.

parameters.description: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
parameters.name: tenant_id

parameters.description: The UUID for the server of interest to you.
parameters.name: server_id

/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/acti.summary: Removes an instance from the server.
/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/acti.title: Remove a shelved instance

/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/acti.description:
Preconditions

- The server status must be ``SHELVED`` or ``SHELVED_OFFLOADED`` .

- If the specified server is locked, you must have administrator
  privileges to unshelve the server.

Asynchronous Postconditions

- After successfully shelving a server, the status changes to
  ``ACTIVE`` . The server appears on the compute node.

- The shelved image is deleted from the list of images returned by
  an API call.

Troubleshooting

- If the server status does not change to ``ACTIVE`` , the unshelve
  operation failed. Ensure that you meet the preconditions and run
  the request again. If the request fails again, investigate
  whether another operation is running that causes a race
  condition.

parameters.description: The UUID for the server of interest to you.

  the request again. If the request fails again, investigate
  whether another operation is running that causes a race
  condition.

This operation stores the VM state on disk, writes all memory to
disk, and stops the virtual machine.

Administrative users might suspend an infrequently used instance or
suspend an instance to perform system maintenance. Suspending an
instance is similar to placing a device in hibernation; memory and
vCPUs become available to create other instances.

/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/os-v.description:
Preconditions

- You can attach a volume to a server with an ``ACTIVE`` ,
  ``PAUSED`` , ``SHUTOFF`` , ``VERIFY_RESIZE`` , or
  ``SOFT_DELETED`` status.

- You can attach a volume to a server with a status that is not
  locked.

- You can attach a volume when its status is ``available`` .

- You can attach a volume when its volume type supports volume
  attaching.

Asynchronous Postconditions

- After successfully attaching a volume to a server, the volume
  status changes to ``in-use`` .

- You can see the attached volume when you log in to the server.

Troubleshooting

- If the volume status remains in ``available`` state, the request
  failed. Ensure that you meet the preconditions and run the
  request again. If the request fails again, investigate the server
  and the volume status.

/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/os-v.title: Show volume attachment details

/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/os-v.description:
Preconditions

- The specified volume must be attached to the server.

- You can detach a volume when the server status is ``ACTIVE`` ,
  ``PAUSED`` , ``SHUTOFF`` , ``VERIFY_RESIZE`` , or
  ``SOFT_DELETED`` .

- You can detach a volume when its status is ``in-use`` .

- You can detach a volume from a server with a status that is not
  locked.

- You cannot detach a root device volume.

Asynchronous Postconditions

- After successfully detaching a volume, its status changes to
  ``available`` .

- The detached volume is no longer visible on the server.

Troubleshooting

- If the volume status remains in ``available`` state, the request
  failed. Ensure that you meet the preconditions and run the
  request again. If the request fails again, investigate whether
  another operation is running that causes a race condition.

- If you attempt to detach a root device volume, this operation
  returns the ``403 HTTP Forbidden`` error code.

/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/os-v.title: Detach volume

tags.name: block-device-mapping

tags.name: createserverext

tags.name: consoles
tags.summary: Gets a console for a server instance.

tags.name: console-output
tags.summary: Gets console output for a server instance.

tags.name: extended-server-attributes
tags.summary: Shows metadata for servers.

tags.name: ext-az
tags.summary:
Shows the instance availability zone for compute nodes (nova-
compute). Internal services appear in their own *internal*
availability zone.

tags.name: extended-status
tags.summary:
Shows the ``vm_state`` , ``task_state`` , and ``power_state``
extended status information in detailed server responses.

tags.name: ext-ips
tags.summary:
Shows the type of the IP addresses that are assigned to an
instance. Type is either fixed or floating.

tags.name: multi-server-create
tags.summary:
Creates one or more servers with an optional reservation ID. The
request and response examples show how to create multiple servers
with or without a reservation ID.

tags.name: server-ext-ips-mac
tags.summary:
Creates, shows information for, and lists servers with the
``mac_addr`` extended attribute.

tags.name: scheduler-hints
tags.summary: Creates a server with scheduler hints.

tags.name: admin-actions
tags.summary:
Administrator only. Performs actions on a server. Specify the
action in the request body.

tags.name: deferred-delete
tags.summary: Force-deletes a server and restores a deleted server.

tags.name: rescue
tags.summary:
Puts a server into rescue mode and unrescues a server in rescue
mode.

tags.name: server-shelve
tags.summary:
Shelves running servers, restores shelved servers, and removes
shelved servers.

Shelving is useful when you have an unused instance that you would
like to keep for later use. For example, at the end of a work week
you can shelve an instance and at the start of the next week you
can unshelve it.

Your cloud provider might bill you for a shelved server.

Use the ``shelve`` action to shelve a server. All associated data
and resources are kept but anything still in memory is not
retained.

Use the ``unshelve`` action to restore a shelved instance.

Use the ``shelveOffload`` action to remove a shelved instance that
you no longer need.

tags.name: server-start-stop
tags.summary: Starts a stopped server and stops a running server.

tags.name: diagnostics
tags.summary: Gets the usage data for a server.

tags.description: Servers and images with disk config (servers, images)
tags.name: disk-config
tags.summary: Extends servers with the ``diskConfig`` attribute.

tags.name: availability-zone
tags.summary: Gets availability zone information.

tags.name: instance-actions
tags.summary:
Lists available actions for a specified server. Administrators can
get details for a specified action for a specified server.

tags.name: server-password
tags.summary:
Gets and resets the encrypted administrative password set through
the metadata service.

tags.name: virtual-interfaces
tags.summary: Lists the virtual interfaces for a specified server instance.

tags.name: volume-attachments
tags.summary:
Attaches volumes that are created through the volume API to server
instances. Also, lists volume attachments for a server instance,
gets volume details for a volume attachment, and detaches a volume.

tags.name: os-volume_boot
tags.summary:
Starts an instance by using a volume with the ``bootable``
attribute. The image on the volume is used to boot the instance.

tags.name: flavormanage
tags.summary: Creates, lists, and deletes flavors.

tags.name: flv-disabled
tags.summary:
Lists and gets details for flavors. Includes the ``disabled``
extended attribute.

tags.name: flavorextradata
tags.summary:
Creates, gets details for, and lists details for flavors. Includes
the rxtx_factor , OS-FLV-EXT-DATA:ephemeral , and swap extended
attributes.

tags.name: flavor-rxtx
tags.summary:
Creates, gets details for, and lists details for flavors. Includes
the rxtx_factor extended attribute, which is related to configured
bandwidth cap values.

tags.name: flavor-extra-specs
tags.summary: Lists, creates, and updates the extra-specs or keys for a flavor.

tags.name: flavor-access
tags.summary:
Creates and gets details for private flavors. Also, lists, adds,
and removes tenants' access to private flavors.

tags.name: flavor-swap
tags.summary:
Creates and lists flavors with a swap value. Requires the ``os-
flavormanage`` extension. The swap value is the amount of swap disk
space, in GBs, to allocate to a server.

tags.name: ext-img-size
tags.summary:
Lists details for available images and gets details for a specified
image. Includes the ``OS-EXT-IMG-SIZE:size`` extended attribute,
which shows the image size.

tags.name: used-limits
tags.summary:
Extends limits to show the project usage. Shows information such as
RAM and instance quotas usage.

tags.description: Limits with project usage for administrators (limits)
tags.name: used-limits-for-admins
tags.summary:
Extends limits to enable administrators to show the project usage
for a specified customer project ID. Shows information such as RAM
and instance quotas usage.

tags.name: agents
tags.summary:
Creates, updates, and deletes guest agents.

Use guest agents to access files on the disk, configure networking,
and run other applications and scripts in the guest while it runs.
This hypervisor-specific extension is not currently enabled for
KVM. Use of guest agents is possible only if the underlying service
provider uses the Xen driver.

tags.name: aggregates
tags.summary:
Creates and manages host aggregates. An aggregate assigns metadata
to groups of compute nodes. Aggregates are only visible to the
cloud provider.

tags.name: baremetal-ext-status
tags.summary: Bare metal nodes.

tags.name: certificates
tags.summary: Creates and shows details for a root certificate.

tags.name: cloudpipe
tags.summary: Manages virtual VPNs for projects.

tags.name: coverage
tags.summary: Shows coverage reports.

tags.name: extended-networks
tags.summary:
Creates, shows details for, and lists networks with extended
attributes.

tags.name: fixed-ips
tags.summary:
Shows data for a specified fixed IP, such as host name, CIDR, and
address. Also, reserves and frees a fixed IP address.

tags.name: floating-ip-dns
tags.summary:
Manages DNS records that are associated with IP addresses that are
allocated by the floating IPs extension. Requests are dispatched to
a DNS driver selected at startup.

tags.name: floating-ip-pools
tags.summary: Manages groups of floating IPs.

tags.name: floating-ips
tags.summary:
Assigns and allocates floating IP addresses to instances that run
in an OpenStack cloud.

tags.name: floating-ips-bulk
tags.summary:
Bulk-creates, deletes, and lists floating IPs. By default, the pool
is named nova. Use the os-floating-ip-pools extension to view
available pools.

tags.name: hosts
tags.summary: Manages physical hosts.

tags.name: hypervisors
tags.summary:
Displays extra statistical information from the machine that hosts
the hypervisor through the API for the hypervisor (XenAPI or
KVM/libvirt).

tags.name: hypervisor-status
tags.summary:
Displays extra statistical information including status from the
machine that hosts the hypervisor through the API for the
hypervisor (XenAPI or KVM/libvirt).

tags.name: interface
tags.summary: Creates, lists, gets details for, and deletes port interfaces.

tags.name: keypairs
tags.summary:
Generates, imports, and deletes SSH keys.

To add a keypair to a server, specify the ``key_name`` parameter in
the request body in a create server request.

tags.name: migrations
tags.summary:
Administrators only. Gets in-progress migrations for a region or
specified cell in a region.

tags.name: networks
tags.summary:
Shows network information for and deletes networks. Also,
disassociates a network from a project in VLAN mode.

tags.name: quota-class-sets
tags.summary: Provides quota classes management support.

tags.name: quota-sets
tags.summary:
Administrators only, depending on policy settings.

Shows quotas for a tenant and shows and updates default quotas.

tags.name: security-groups
tags.summary:
Lists, lists by server, creates, shows information for, updates,
and deletes security groups.

tags.name: os-security-group-rules
tags.summary: Creates and deletes security group rules.

tags.name: security-group-default-rules
tags.summary:
Lists, shows information for, and creates default security group
rules.

tags.name: server-groups
tags.summary: Lists, shows information for, creates, and deletes server groups.

tags.name: services
